关于这个游戏，玩法与手感显然是许多人诟病的一大缺陷，但我要批评的是它的叙事。当初看剧情介绍之后很果断地买了，玩下来却发现无论主角还是NPC，人均谜语人，压根不知道台词在讲什么，那对双胞胎男女是谁，大鸟什么来头，伤膝河之战又是什么，伊丽莎白的泪眼是怎么回事，她妈又怎么会变成孤魂，游戏皆未交代清楚，这使得原本是短板的画质和枪械手感更加让玩家伤脑筋。后来忍受不了莫名其妙的剧情，上网搜索剧情详解，恍然大悟的同时也被剧透完了，但不看的话又根本玩不懂——叙述者口齿不清，剧情再优秀又怎样？

This game is the worst successor to the bioshock franchise that could've ever been made. It dumbs the formula started by bioshock 1 to such an extreme degree that it no longer even fits within the immersive sim genre. To put it in simple terms, bioshock original was an immersive sim with a heavy emphasis on action; it could play like an fps in parts, but it was at its core a successor to the system shock franchise and played as such most of the time. It was a simpler and more accessible game than that venerable franchise, but it still had that depth in both gameplay and story. bioshock shitfinite, on the other hand, is literally just an FPS with at best minor rpg influence and is in no way an immersive sim. 
First of all, im gonna talk about the story because that is the part that pisses me off the most. The story is so ham-fisted and hypocritical that it can't even compete with the older bioshock game.  The original bioshock was a critique of late-stage capitalism and the inherent flaws of a society of unchecked ambition, but it never felt the need to hammer that message into the player. It merely presented its world and its story to you, and expected you to put the pieces together yourself. Bioshock infinite screws this up by not only making the story so explicit in purpose, but also further hammering it in with a talkative main character and sidekick that constantly verbalize the message you are supposed to be getting. Like they will not shut the hell up for 5 seconds, its like the developers heard the phrase "death of the author" and thought it was supposed to be literal or something. And can we talk about how racist this story is for a second? the main take away the game basically forces on you from the whole subplot of the resistance vs Columbia is that yeah the horrible capitalist and slavery oppression thing is bad but armed resistance against it is just as bad. The leader of the resistance tries to murder a child because he was the child of an oppressor, and it makes literally no sense for her to have done that like what? And then the main characters start openly discussing this and say "yeah she was just as bad as the literal slave laborer for trying to kill one child, which made no sense for her to do but lmao" The writers clearly realized that their plotline was dumb and tried to hamfist in some bullsh*t trait for the resistance leader to paint them as bad. They are literally propaganda-ing at you in a story that is supposed to be anti-propagandist. Not to mention that, to stop the child killing, your partner, the pretty white girl who is pure and delicate and innocent, has to stab her dead on the spot. Like this is so clearly a racist attempt to paint resistance against oppression as badly as the oppression in the first place, and its so blatantly hypocritical and i never see anyone talking about it.
And for the part that everyone other than me cares about, the gameplay. Story doesn't matter if the game is fun, right? Well, it isn't. Not for me, and not for anyone who actually understood what made bioshock 1 good in the first place. The original bioshock had large, open-ended levels, enemies that encourage subversion of mechanics using your own wits, and resource management mechanics that also encouraged the use of powers and weapons in creative ways to be as efficiant as possible. Bioshock infinite, however, is basically just call of duty with a prettier reskin over it. The best way to prove my point is the fire plasmid. In bioshock 1, you could use the fire to attack enemies directly, or you could be smarter with it and use it to melt ice for resources and alternate paths, light oil on fire and lead enemies into it, use it on wind traps to turn them into fire traps, all sorts of things that allow you to be creative with the plasmid's use, and the claustraphobic level design and focus on melee enemies enabled this. However, the fights in infinite are too open and fast paced for this sort of creative problem solving to apply, so the fire power is basically relegated to the status of being a reskinned grenade from every other fps game in existence. The few powers that are designed well are either useless or so blatantly overpowered that it makes other powers completely obsolete. The crow swarm power is the best example of this, you can use only that for most of the game and get through it just fine. And the ghost fight, jeezus christ don't get me started on the ghost fight. This thing is so bad that it makes the bioshock 1 final boss look like Ornstein and Smough by comparison. It is by far the worst boss ever created in the history of game design. Its so damn bad that you can easily softlock yourself from the rest of the game because you straight up ran out of bullets in the boss arena, making the fight unwinnable. That fight by itself brings the gameplay down from "below average" to "hot garbage." Don't buy this game its terrible.

许多人对《生化奇兵：无限》的最深刻的印象就是那个让人百感交集的女孩——伊丽莎白，无论是长发时的天真可爱还是剪发后的坚强果决，她占据了玩家们的几乎全部视野。

但其实，她只是一个障眼法。无限的主体故事讲得是一个“父”的自我毁灭，整部作品中可以说只有一个女性角色：康姆斯托克夫人。

要看出“父”的自述需要先了解其本质，也就是“主体性的集中”。社会中男性如何从孩童过度到成人，或者说自立，方法很简单——夺回主体性。而主体性的回归意味着权力与责任的双重回归，即做事随心所欲不受高层权力束缚、犯错独自承担没有上层负责人兜底。落到实处来讲就是：纵欲、受创，权力的回归最终将进阶到权力的集中，表现为“父”将自己的意志施加于他人，同时“父”也代替他人承受痛苦。两者一体双面，是主体性集中面对不同外界作用的正负反应。

布克的故事就是“父”诞生的故事——集中主体性。

布克在故事中被天然性地赋予“父”这一社会身份，但从伤膝河开始他就一直回避社会的要求，拒绝承认、面对自己“父”的身份。布克的颓废、自责本质上都源自于无法承受创伤、消化痛苦，这恰恰违背的“父”的本质要求，拒绝痛苦即是让渡主体性，对责任的推卸会从根本上瓦解“父”，社会无法容忍这种对“父”的伤害，而布克作为社会的产物及其一份子，潜意识里不由自主地趋向于完成“父”的诞生，即使这种行为会损害自身。

在伤膝河之后他进行了对“父”两次短暂回避，一是接受洗礼，二是娶妻生子。在主体宇宙中前者失败了，“父”的感召让他难以就此简单地推卸掉责任，所以他妥协并尝试通过其他方式完成“父”的诞生——组成家庭，以此逃避伤膝河的罪恶。很可惜，后者也失败了。布克再次陷入对“父”的恐惧与逃避之中，整日酗酒赌博，最终出售女儿正是逃避“父”的恐惧心理极端化的体现。最后一刻反悔更像是一种讽刺，布克最终又使自己陷入“希望破灭，逃避责任”的循环之中。

接下来我们将进入故事的开头，即布克在二十年后前往哥伦比亚救伊丽莎白，但这时一定不能像之前一样视此布克为完整的主体，而是要将他视为“布克”的一部分碎片。其实我们通过角色的死亡与重生过场也能看出此布克的残缺：每次布克死亡后都会从出租屋内开门回到哥伦比亚，其实表现了平行世界的布克替换了死亡的布克，他就如同批量生产的零件一样，单独并不具有主体性。

布克的失忆让他丧失了成人男性的主体性，他在不了解客体的情况下无法为自己的行为负责，他变成了一个“男孩”。开头的布克可以看作“布克”肢体的延伸，仅仅是用来接触女儿伊丽莎白的手段、工具。而在救出伊丽莎白之后，“布克”的碎片开始慢慢填充进他的身份中，伊丽莎白的主体性开始转移到布克身上。具体表现为伊丽莎白与他共情，他为伊丽莎白提供保护，替伊丽莎白承受创伤。事实上后者已经足够支撑起“父”的部分，上文已说明纵欲、受创一体两面，有一必有二，如同高、低必定同时出现，两者互为依托。

后来布克就开始行使“父“的权力，他将飞艇的目的地定到纽约，无视了伊丽莎白个体的意愿，此时的布克依旧是残缺状态，所以迎来的是伊丽莎白的一锤子。这部分恰恰即为社会中男性成人过程的一个微缩演示，伊丽莎白此时扮演的就是向“父”夺取主体性的男孩角色，尽管她还没有摆脱作为“布克”肢体延伸的身份，但她已经开启成人的进程。

失败的布克不得已认可了和女孩的伙伴关系，从此以后，布克的补完进度便被有意回拨，“父”的更多部分被交接给伊丽莎白。在之后的旅途中布克的过往被慢慢揭开，而他也随着真相的迫近变得越发敏感脆弱，“父”的碎片从他身上脱落，他一步步变成了纯粹的“男孩”。而伊丽莎白在杀死黛西后，彻底完成了从女孩到母亲的身份转变，作为“父”的延伸，她占据的权重上升。值得注意的是，伊丽莎白作为“父”的延伸的女性元素，以及她作为主体的“男孩”身份是同时存在的。

伊丽莎白的主体性越发完整，她所知所为也就越发超越布克的掌控，后来的路上，伊丽莎白扮演着母亲的角色去引导“男孩”一步一步走近真相，完成“父”的诞生。与此同时，伊丽莎白“男孩”的身份也随着“父”权重的上升，通过扮演母亲进一步完成成人进程。

这也是我们在玩游戏的后期感受到的伤感情绪的来源——本应被我保护女孩已经长大成人，而我却一无所知、一无所能。当伊丽莎白已经独立承受创伤，去了解一切时，我们扮演的布克却依旧像孩子一样懵懂，甚至隐隐地抗拒成长，回避责任。其体现便是布克愤怒地杀死康姆斯托克，对女孩表示自己毫不知情。“I will show you”，我来展示给你看，我爱你，我在乎你。这种如同稚童般表现自己的行为，真正让玩家为布克感到悲哀，他在乎的是自己被人误解，而伊丽莎白需要的却是布克的成熟。

故事到了这里，我们还漏掉了布克的很大一块碎片，那就是康姆斯托克。也许有人认为康姆斯托克具备完整的主体性，他就是另一种布克，甚至作为“Father Comstock”进行大规模的集权，真正完成了“父”的诞生。但康姆斯托克本质上 依旧只是“布克”的碎片，无法单独成形，原因便在于他依旧逃避了责任，这瓦解了他后来一系列成为“父”行为的根基。

康姆斯托克将过去的一切罪恶推卸到布克身上，否认自己的责任，这种彻底的逃避导致他后来无论如何纵欲（行使权力）都无法真正成为“父”。最终也只能作为“布克”补完的材料，通过被布克杀死来促进碎片的融合。

虹吸装置被破坏后伊丽莎白的力量空前壮大，“父”的权重有了物质力量的外壳终于在她身上膨胀起来，而接下来的故事很明了：纵欲、受创。伊丽莎白首先杀死了童年好友夜莺，独自承担其痛楚。接着不顾布克“去巴黎”的要求，强行帮助布克回忆一切，这时的伊丽莎白作为“父”的肢体延伸，在以母亲的角色促成“布克”亦即 “父”的诞生。最后一刻，她以“男孩”身份夺回的主体性使她短暂挣脱了“父”的控制，伊丽莎白按住布克推门的手“你 确定 这真的是你想要的吗？”。

但这无济于事，碎片终将合并，“父”就在门后。

布克推开了那扇门，清澈的河水、环绕的子嗣，生与死在这一刻交织。

扮演着母亲的伊丽莎白揭晓真相，在象征着羊水的水中宣告“布克”的诞生。“Booker DeWitt，Comstock，no，I am both.”

扮演着子嗣的伊丽莎白，作为“父”的肢体延伸，执行“布克”的意志——自杀。降生的前一刻他还懵懂无知，降生的后一刻他却自我毁灭，如此一来“父”终于完整，责任已负，人死债销。作为“父”延伸的伊丽莎白就此消失，布克的故事终于结束。

Espectacular, entre los 3 no se con cual quedarme, es uno mejor que el otro. 
Este en particular no sigue la misma historia de los dos primeros, se centra en otra distinta pero igual de buena, realmente si algo hay que destacarle a la saga es la impresionante narrativa que tiene. Siendo distinto, de igual forma mantiene ciertas características que lo asemejan a los primeros y te dan esos toques de nostalgia, logrados mediante ambientes, sonidos, imágenes.
Las novedades de jugar con un acompañante, nuevas formas de desplazamiento y alguna que otra nueva característica le aportan un aire nuevo que siempre se agradece.
Supieron hacer un juego distinto, manteniendo todo lo bueno y deslubrando con la trama. 
El DLC Burial at Sea es un cajón de recuerdos abierto, un placer visual, te embebe de añoranza. Pero además de esto, es el final necesario que termina de cerrar todo, la cereza del postre. El capitulo 2 implementa muchas mecánicas nuevas y se siente realmente distinto al juego principal, vale la pena cada segundo, siento que es una compra obligada.

While I'm familiar with the other Bioshock games, this is the first one I've actually played. Firstly, I absolutely loved the story (as with the past ones), but I was freaking out at the end it was SO good. 
I like that the variety of guns & vigors allows you to fight with many different styles, weather you want to switch it up in the same game or max out a few specific weapons in different games. There were 2 vigors I never even used & it didn't matter at all. I ended up favoring Shock Jockey & Murder of Crows, but still used others every once in awhile. I liked that you could access the unequipped vigors easily in battle. I do wish you could have at least 1 other weapon in the same way (like a pistol) but they are really easy to come across as they are always dropped by enemies. All in all 10/10.

If multilayered, twisting story is what you generally try to find in games, play BioShock Infinite.

If fun gameplay featuring grappling hooks in midair, using different types of telekinetic powers against a vast array of enemy units ATOP a flying city is your choice, play BioShock Infinite.

Either way, you're in for a treat once you fire up this game. It goes from very pleasant and warm city tour experience to a dark pursuit so suddenly, it sometimes catches you off-guard. The mixture of comedy, laughter and bloodshed is so fantastically built that it literally does not get boring ONCE. 

Also, they just do a perfect mic drop with the climax. They do a perfect job of hiding it till the very end, the sign of a deep and greatly written story. Elizabeth and Booker are probably two of the most memorable characters I've seen in games, 3 years later, I still remember bits and pieces of that game along with the ending.

Highly recommended!

It's hard to imagine that this game is almost 8 years old now. I still remember the hype surrounding the release of this game. There's just something special about all these games that is very difficult to put into words. Irrational Games portray different ideals of human governance and take them to their logical extremes, and then explore the natural consequences of what a world like that would produce (with some science bullshittery in the mix to make it fun). It was unchecked neo-liberal capitalism for Bioshock 1 and 2, and Antebellum America for Bioshock Infinite. 

In infinite, you are in a floating city, headed by a "prophet" who built the city in holy reverence of God and the founding fathers of America who then proceeded to secede from the Union after being met with controversy by the government for making the unilateral decision of stopping the Boxer Rebellion in Peking. That's just the tip of the iceberg, with themes of pre-destination explored through quantum entanglement, race, religion, revolution, and imprisonment all being explored.

Honestly, I couldn't recommend this game more. I replay it from time to time, and each time I am blown away by the main campaign. It's not the best GAME in the world- the shooting is real meh and it feels kinda clunky- but it is one of the best experiences i've had in a game. In an era where games rarely try to make statements anymore, this game stands out on that regard. Play it. In fact, play all the Bioshocks (2 included, it gets a too bad of a rap for what it is).
